Detailed Description

Utility class to aid in matching URIs in content providers.

To use this class, build up a tree of UriMatcher objects. Typically, it looks something like this:

The following code is declared in header file. 

     static final int PEOPLE = 1;
     static final int PEOPLE_ID = 2;
     static final int PEOPLE_PHONES = 3;
     static final int PEOPLE_PHONES_ID = 4;
     static final int PEOPLE_CONTACTMETHODS = 7;
     static final int PEOPLE_CONTACTMETHODS_ID = 8;
     static final int DELETED_PEOPLE = 20;
     static final int PHONES = 9;
     static final int PHONES_ID = 10;
     static final int PHONES_FILTER = 14;
     static final int CONTACTMETHODS = 18;
     static final int CONTACTMETHODS_ID = 19;
     static final int CALLS = 11;
     static final int CALLS_ID = 12;
     static final int CALLS_FILTER = 15;

     static gaia::content::UriMatcher* mURLMatcher;

The correspoinding cpp file. 

 UriMatcher* UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher = new UriMatcher(ROOT);
 void initUriMatcher()
 {
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String(), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_ID);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#/phones"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_PHONES);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#/phones/blah"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_PHONES_ID);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#/phones/#"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_PHONES_ID);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#/addresses"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_ADDRESSES);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#/addresses/#"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_ADDRESSES_ID);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#/contact-methods"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_CONTACTMETH);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("people"), String("#/contact-methods/#"), UriMatcherTest::PEOPLE_CONTACTMETH_ID);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("calls"), String(), UriMatcherTest::CALLS);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("calls"), String("#"), UriMatcherTest::CALLS_ID);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("caller-id"), String(), UriMatcherTest::CALLERID);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("caller-id"), String("*"), UriMatcherTest::CALLERID_TEXT);
     UriMatcherTest::mURLMatcher->addURI(String("filter-recent"), String(), UriMatcherTest::FILTERRECENT);

 }

Then when you need to match match against a URI, call match, providing the tokenized url you've been given, and the value you want if there isn't a match. You can use the result to build a query, return a type, insert or delete a row, or whatever you need, without duplicating all of the if-else logic you'd otherwise need. Like this:

 public String getType(const String& url)
 {
      int match = mURLMatcher->match(url, NO_MATCH);
      switch (match)
      {
           case PEOPLE:
               return String("vnd.android.cursor.dir/person");
           case PEOPLE_ID:
               return String("vnd.android.cursor.item/person");
 ... snip ...
               return String("vnd.android.cursor.dir/snail-mail");
           case PEOPLE_ADDRESS_ID:
               return String"vnd.android.cursor.item/snail-mail");
           default:
               return String();
       }
   }

instead of

 public String getType(const String& url)
 {
      if (url.length >= 2) {
           if (url[1].equals("people")) {
               if (url.length == 2) {
                   return "vnd.android.cursor.dir/person";
               } else if (url.length == 3) {
                   return "vnd.android.cursor.item/person";
 ... snip ...
                   return "vnd.android.cursor.dir/snail-mail";
               } else if (url.length == 3) {
                   return "vnd.android.cursor.item/snail-mail";
               }
           }
      }
      return null;
 }

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::content::UriMatcher::addURI ( const base::String &  authority,
const base::String &  path,
int32_t  code 
)

Add a URI to match, and the code to return when this URI is matched.

URI nodes may be exact match string, the token "*" that matches any text, or the token "#" that matches only numbers.

Parameters:
authoritythe authority to match
paththe path to match. * may be used as a wild card for any text, and # may be used as a wild card for numbers.
codethe code that is returned when a URI is matched against the given components. Must be positive.
int32_t gaia::content::UriMatcher::match ( const net::Uri &  uri)

Try to match against the path in a url.

Parameters:
uriThe url whose path we will match against.
Returns:
The code for the matched node (added using addURI), or -1 if there is no matched node.
UriMatcher& gaia::content::UriMatcher::operator= ( const UriMatcher &  o) [private]
